description: I order delivery and am consistently happy with my meal. My favorites are the Lizzie roll, agedashi tofu, and the cucumber salad with asparagus and crab. I would highly recommend these items. This restaurant has great delivery sushi!
author: Laura L.

description:
I think this is the only time I've ordered from them and it took 90 minutes to arrive, but it is quite good. The gyoza have thin pastry instead of the thick kind that you usually see and is quite nice. It was about $35 for six gyoza, a substantial maki, two orders of nigiri and miso. The fish is fresh and clean. I would definitely order from them again and recommend it. 

Generous portions on the nigiri, everything I've tasted so far is delicious. 

I wouldn't change anything about the food but I would like nicer chopstix and a  container to mix the soy sauce in

ETA: Near the end I bit down on something hard and spat out a slice of bone that somehow got in my Hamachi roll. !?! Took a star off.  

I would still probably eat here again because the food really is very tasty. But I would chew carefully
author: Amy T.

description: OOOO YEEUHH MIZOHONGRY FOR SOME SUSHAY.  I place this place on a tier 2 type of sushi place but its a dam good tier two.  The price is fairly ok but the scallop was dam good.  Don't fall for the o-toro or any fatty tuna because they either give you slivers which makes it not enjoyable as the real thang or its straight up on the real thang.  Otherwise, I'f I'm not willing to wait for the high end ones or any others I'll park my ass straight here.  Oh the fatty albacore was good too.
author: Vince L.

description:
Came for Saturday lunch and it was fairly empty. The atmosphere here was nice and quiet. 

We decided to go with the lunch combos. Definitely a steal and very filling. We got the combo a (chicken teriyaki + tempura + ca roll), combo b (shrimp tempura + 5 nigiri), and a bay scallop roll. Way too much food for the two of us, but definitely had a hard time deciding and wanted everything. 

The waitress also listed a bunch of specials but we had a difficult time understanding plus there seemed to be so many specials. Would had liked it if they can just list their specials on a board. Would make it easier for the waitresses too. 

Omg the presentation of their food is gorgeous. Love the nigiri, the fish was very fresh and definitely melts in your mouth. My favorite was the salmon belly ! The shrimp tempura roll and CA roll was pretty good. We found the chicken teriyaki to be solid but a little on the dry side. The tempura was so delicious. But I love tempura and fried food so fresh tempura is usually always a hit with me ! Love the bay scallop roll. A little heavy on the sauce for me. But will definitely be back to try their other rolls.

Plus don't forget to check in for that huge portion of seaweed salad !
author: Wendy L.

description:
Step 1. Recognize that this neighborhood is full of Japanese restaurants. Step 2. They are fairly indistinguishable from one another. Step 3. Accept that they are generally decent but are aimed at Americans. Step 4. Find a couple of decent ones as your go to places. Did you sense my sense resignation? It is true. Great expectations result in great disappointments. Setting realistic expectations will make you appreciate the little things in life and live longer and happier.

For instance, if checking in on yelp, you get a free seaweed salad. The rolls are robust and fresh and flavorful. Like in Japan, you do not need wasabi or soy to wash them down.  The Hamachi appetizer is surprisingly large in portion and very filling and super good to boot. 

The setting is nice. The bar seating is very comfortable and not crowded. it's a cut above your usual Inner Richmond sushi joints. Priced moderately. 

Come with those who appreciate good sushi at everyday price.
author: Victoria E.

description:
A friend and I came to Mizutani to catch up over some sushi. I've only seen pictures of their rolls on yelp, but they looked really good! We ended up ordering three rolls to share:

- Bay Island Roll: My favorite roll! I loved the seared scallops on top (tbh I love anything seared hahaha), the sauces, and the unagi!
- Sunset Stripped Roll: We ordered this sans the soy paper and subbed it for nori, and added rice. This roll was so simple, but you could really taste how fresh the fish was! These were bigger pieces, so I believe the roll only came with 5 pieces.
- Bento Maki Roll: Soft shell crab topped with different types of fish--I enjoyed the crunch of this roll, but probably would try a diff roll next time.

There's also a yelp check-in deal where you get a free seaweed salad upon check-in! Take advantage!

Service was friendly and the sushi was great! I'll be back! The omakase also caught my eye at $38, maybe next time.
author: Tara A.

description:
This place doesn't have authentic Japanese food, but they do have great service and clean restaurant. 

My boyfriend and I came here for a late lunch, around 2 PM on Monday (after another medical appointment.) The restaurant was empty and we were quickly seated.

Boyfriend ordered the combo lunch with three items ($14.95): California roll, tempura, and I think a teriyaki chicken. This also came with rice, salad, and miso soup. I ordered the vegetable udon ($9.) 

The udon didn't taste like Japanese udon at all. The restaurant used chicken soup and non traditional vegetables (like bok choy), as compared to the sansai (mountain vegetable) udon I've had at authentic Japanese restaurants. In addition, the portion was small. I was not full, and went to another cafe immediately afterwards for an acai bowl. On the other hand, the combo lunch seemed a bit better - it was a lot of food for a pretty good price. I didn't like how the restaurant added furikake to the outside of the California rolls though. 

Service was great, perhaps because we were the only ones dining in the restaurant. Waiters would check up on us frequently and were genuinely friendly. 

Overall, I wouldn't eat here again - $$ for not very good food.
author: Christine L.

description:
Tired of the usual one hour wait at a popular sushi joint downtown? 

Me too! 

That's where Mizutani comes in. It's located in a quiet neighborhood of the Inner Richmond. So we drove all the way from downtown on a Friday night and was immediately seated without fuss. 

Our friends are regulars here and swear by their sashimi. They are right! The omakase selection which is priced at $38, offers thick cuts of fresh fish. Mind you, these aren't your more unusual cuts of fish, but rather composed of the more commonly known varieties such as tuna, yellowtail, salmon, etc. But you can't beat that price for the amount of food that you get!

We also enjoyed several apps from agedashi tofu (served with mushrooms and scallions in a light dashi broth), scallop and crab cakes (with pickled cucumber and jalapenos), baked mussels (with tobiko and green onion) and hamachi carpaccio topped with avocado and jalapenos. Everything was well prepared and provided a lovely segue into our meal.

They also have Americanized rolls doused in special sauces to cater to palates not used to pure sashimi ;-) If you're watching your carb intake,  get the Sunset Stripped roll which has salmon, hamachi, tuna, avocado and tobiko wrapped in cucumber. I could eat two of this and not get tired of it, because it's so incredibly delicious!

I love the service provided by the amicable staff, they truly make you feel welcome at their restaurant. Since discovering Mizutani, our go to sushi place will definitely have some stiff competition now.
author: Janice C.

description:
Expensive compared to other Japanese restaurants.

The usual rock and roll that would be $6 elsewhere is $9 here. Mushroom soup is $5 so you get the drift.

The baked mussels were dry with tobiko and green onion and not much flavor. Kind of stale tasting mussels underneath.

Their using tastes like something you can get out of a packet. And the grilled beef teriyaki was overcooked even though I asked for it medium rare. 

Waste of $20 and the "New York steak" 
That they used was very chewy.

The salmon nigiri didn't taste fresh either.

Yeah, I'd skip this place.
author: Jack R.

description:
Ordered takeout from this little sushi restaurant and  I was pretty impressed. I'm a big fan of sushi and a tough critic, but the sushi did not disappoint. 

I ordered the following items: 

1. Agedashi Tofu
2. Dragon roll 
3. Sunset stripped roll
4. Vegetarian temaki
5. Oshinko maki
6. Avocado, cucumber and sesame maki
7. Bento roll
8. Mizutani salad roll 

All the sushi rolls were very nicely packaged and were extremely fresh. In most instances, when ordering takeout, restaurants don't care much about the sushi's presentation, however with this place, they really made sure to make it look just like it would if it were to be served at the restaurant. 

I specifically enjoyed the sushi because it was easy to tell that it was extremely fresh. The fish was melt in your mouth quality and there was a particular uniqueness to each roll. I truly fell in love with the Mizutani salad roll. I've never tried something like it and it's a must have at this sushi restaurant.

Additionally, my go to appetizer at every place is the agedashi tofu and this tofu was pretty spot on. Even 30 minutes after I started eating it, the tofu stayed warm, juicy, and flavorful. 

Can't wait to come here and have dinner in person!
author: Julia K.

description:
Great super-fast service, creative maki. "Lover's roll" was a unique treat, particularly on Valentine's Day.

Sadly one of their specials gave me food poisoning -- probably the overdressed Shigoku oysters, but possibly the spicy scallop temaki. Either way I got to relive the whole meal onto porcelain a few hours later!

Maybe stick with the menu.
author: Khalil B.

description:
Absolute hidden gem in the Inner Richmond! I live in the neighborhood and we have date nights here frequently because of their exceptionally fresh sushi and friendly atmosphere. Every time we come they make us feel like they've been waiting for us! 
The do even the little things right, like a California roll coated in spices and seasonings. We always try at least 1 special. Once we had the Live Scallop that was absolutely to die for. Tonight we had the Bay Island roll with unagi and seared scallop and we both melted from sheer excellence. It might be in the top 10 of sushi rolls I ve ever had
author: Patrick H.

description:
This is probably my new go to spot in town. And especially in the Laurel Heights neighborhood. My boyfriend and I were looking for a new spot in town, and we stumbled upon this great sushi bar and restaurant right off of 6th and California. 

Like some of the other reviewers have mentioned, if the quality of fish is important to you, then this should be the place. We ordered a total of four rolls and all of the fish was amazing and very fresh. You could taste the difference of the quality and even the quantity of fish that they put on each individual rolls. My favorite was probably the spicy tuna and salmon roll. (I totally forgot the name, sorry). The service was great, and they even gave us a salad on the house :)
author: Micah L.

description:
Fairly price, good but not the freshest in town. 

I came here to catch up with a friend. I think that this place is good and ordering three rolls was enough for two girls. We ordered the bay island roll, sunset stripped roll, and bento maki. 

The bay island roll was a seared scallop roll with unagi. I thought this was yummy. You could taste that slight charred flavor. 
The sunset stripped roll. We asked to replace the cucumber with seaweed and rice, making it a more filling roll. It had three different types of fish in it and they were fairly good. 
The bento maki roll was a soft shell crab roll. It was good, but I really couldn't find the crab in it. 

Overall, it's a very fairly priced place to go but when you're in sf, you might as well go for the finest fish. It was good for what it was. It's what you pay for.
author: Tina Y.

description:
We had planned to go to Tanuki's for dinner, but they were closed on Monday. So, we decided to try Mizutani. I'm glad we did! We had the Double Hamachi Roll, Lover's Roll, Tekka Maki, California Roll, fresh oysters and fried calamari legs. The fish was fresh and the presentation was very nice. Loves the delicate spicy sauce and the cute jalapeño slices! 

We were the only ones sitting for table service, as there is sushi bar service too. Service was pleasant and efficient. 

I would return to try the other sushi rolls.
author: Lena L.

description: 8 pc nigiri was really good! Comes with salad (dressing is very yummy). The first bite I had was the white on - top right - it melted in my mouth, it was so good!! Everything tasted really fresh (maybe the maguro wasn't relatively as good as how great the others were, but understandable). They charge you $1 for tea. Service was okay for them only having one server. I'd definitely try again, maybe the 10pc next time.
author: Soo L.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend - we ordered a plethora of food because it all sounded so good. We weren't disappointed. In addition to the complimentary house salad they offer, yelpers checking in also receive a free seaweed salad. 

We ordered:
Agedashi Tofu appetizer - I was expecting soft tofu, but this was fried. Nonethess, very tasty. 
Fried oysters - comes with spicy tuna and seaweed slaw. Very delicious.
My favorite was the Heather Roll (Seared albacore, shrimp and jalapeno garlic sauce). That garlic sauce added just the right amount of umami that made this roll unforgettable.
We also ordered the Simon Roll (Assorted fish deep fried tempura style with spicy crab) which was also delicious. 

Service was great - they kept the hot tea and ice water flowing and didn't mind that we were chatting for a long time. Would love to come back when I'm in the area.
author: Nicha K.

description:
Great Japanese food. Teriyaki steak and Chicken teriyaki were excellent. Their house salad dressing was an excellent complement to their toss salad. I will definitely order their salad again. The Caterpillar Sushi roll was superb. Their service is excellent and employees are very friendly.  

I will definitely put Mizutani Sushi Bar on my to eat list whenever I'm in San Francisco.
author: Lawrence Y.

description: Arrived at 6 pm on a Saturday night. There were 3 other tables of 4 people. We were seated quickly and the daily specials were explained to us. Our order was taken and beverages brought out promptly. Waitress checked our tea pot after 10 minutes, poured tea into our 1/2 full cups and refilled the pot. Sushi rolls, sashimi and unagi was very good. Wait staff checked on us often. Before we left the tables in the rear section of the restaurant were full. Enjoyed our dinner here.
author: VC D.

description:
I tried this restaurant out once, and I don't think I'll ever come back. I wasn't very impressed.
I ordered 2 lunch specifics with salmon teriyaki, California rolls and 5 piece nigiri. The salmon teriyaki was hard and a little cold. The California rolls were mediocre. Miso salad was warm.
The tuna nigiri was tasty, but I only had one piece of it.
The place was not that busy. It took a while for the food to come out and we only received half of the order and had to wait for our other half to be served.
Overall, the staff was slow, but very polite. 
Disappointed to not like this spot, but you can't win them all :/
author: Kevin S.

description:
4 stars are specifically for their rolls.

Came here for lunch on a weekday, and was surprised to see the restaurant was practically empty. We were really hungry and while we were interested in the lunch sushi combos, they didn't seem like they were worth the price in terms of filling us up =)...

- Complimentary salad: the dressing is sooo delicious!! Nutty, tangy, savory... yum! 
- Miso soup: standard miso soup, but I appreciated how it wasn't overly-salty like how other restaurants tend to make them.
- Double hamachi roll: hamachi with cucumber and green onions, topped with hamachi, jalapeño, spicy mayo & sriracha. This was way too spicy for us, so we just took out the jalapeño and the spicy sauces. It was still delicious and fresh! 
- Sunflower roll: Salmon, avocado, tuna and mango rolled in soy paper. The soy paper wasn't chewy or hard--everything went well together and was creamy and delicious! The mango was soft and ripe and gave a nice sweet touch.
- Bay island roll: Our favorite roll! Unagi and avocado topped with seared scallops, tobiko and green onions. Absolutely delicious!

Beautiful presentation of food, service was wonderful (granted we were the only ones there when we left), and the ambiance and environment seemed to be very clean and welcoming. 

Oh, and thank you to a fellow yelper that wrote that they charge for tea!
author: Kris C.

description: This is our go to place for sushi in the Inner Richmond. Highly recommend it! Looking for something to try? Recommendations: Mizutani Roll, Bento roll and the Double Hamachi, oh and the house salad is delicious, too. All really yummy. We have also ordered delivery and they always get it right. Staff is pleasant, location is clean, food is delicious and super high quality.
author: Cece H.

description: Great sushi and they deliver! Everything was fresh and the nigiri was especially good!
author: Adrienne C.

description:
I've always been skeptical of going to sushi restaurants due to previous bad experiences but Mizutani may have renewed my faith in them. 

A bit on the pricier side, Mizutani serves the freshest, most visually appealing, and arguably the tastiest sushi in the Richmond District. The establishment has a classy vibe to it and the waiters are well mannered. The wait time is average, as expected of any sushi joint that makes their rolls fresh. We ordered multiple rounds of food as we kept wanting more to satisfy our hunger. I am bookmarking this place as a great place to take a potential date in the future. Mizutani has earned my trust and respect.
author: Golden H.

description:
My favorite sushi place ! Food quality always excellent. I order delivery and visit the store often. For delivery, my favourite is the bento roll, lion king roll, and the mizutani salad roll. Dragon roll is pretty good too. Also recommend their seared ahi tuna dinner set as well if you're looking for something other than sushi. 

I really like soft shell crab and the bento roll is the only roll in SF I found that's not just a plain spider roll, so I always get that for delivery. Mizutani salad roll is like a dream. I don't get enough vegetables in my diet and this is my way of cheating because it taste amazing and there's still a decent amount of vegetable.
author: Sean T.

description: My husband and I really love this place. The chicken teriyaki is excellent. They use white meat, which is our preference.  It is wonderfully light on sauce and served over the most delicious mix of sauteed mixed vegetables. We round it out with edamame and an assortment of sushi. So yumny and worth the price.
author: Denise M.

description:
I think I crave sushi about 10 a week and I love Mizutani! I've been here a few times with family and friends and always leave stuffed! 

Sushi is super fresh and the servings are fairly large compared to other trendy sushi restaurants around downtown SF. Trick is to go out to the avenues and the food is always fresher and larger! Mizutani also offers a complimentary house salad with ginger dressing to start. I've tried several salmon and tuna rolls as well as a few special ones and I can't choose a favorite.

The atmosphere is casual and low-key but sleek at the same time. Servers are really attentive and you never wait long to order or get their attention. Prices are fairly standard, not too cheap, not too expensive but you do get a good value for the price!
author: Stefanie K.

description:
Got takeout from here - not making that mistake again. Felt like I overpayed :/
The sushi rolls were very small, plain, and uninteresting.

The soy sauce comes in small bags that are hard to use, and there wasn't a lot of wasabi.

The worst part was some terribly overcooked edamame beans, or maybe they were just stale.
author: Malthe J.

description:
Such a gem in the Richmond! Came here on a Wednesday night- definitely one of two groups there. Sat at the bar with the sushi chefs. 

Service was great- came back often, constantly refilling our tea, and asking if we needed anything. Granted, we were practically the only ones in the restaurant. Complimentary salad was good too- fan of the dressing.

So the reason Mizutani gets 4 stars from me is because I didn't break the bank to have good quality nigiri. We did the chef's choice and both my friend and I agreed it was some of the better, fresh fish that we've had in the city. Actually made me wish we ordered more nigiri instead of rolls- which don't get me wrong, the rolls were good, but not as good as the nigiri. Often, I find myself wishing I ordered rolls that smothered the fish in sauce to hide the poor quality. Not the case here- really enjoyed it. Didn't need to dip anything in soy sauce. 

Chefs were nice. I'd come back here if I was in the Richmond and wanted to hide from the crowds of Clement.
author: Arezou A.

description:
A Really solid sushi joint. The sushi here isn't the best, it isn't the freshest, but I think its adequate. They have a lot of choices on their menu and I think the prices are fair. My friends and I came here in the evening and there were only a few people here eating. Inside it felt homey, makes you feel comfortable. Everything they serve you looks nice, even the teapot, so thats a plus. I tried the Chirashi and my friends basically ordered the same thing. The fish was fine but in a sushi roll I can tell that they would be good if we decided to order some. 

The reason why I gave this place a thumbs up is because it reminds me of the place that I get my sushi in my home town when I crave it. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go out and drive 45 minutes to get here, but if I lived in the area or happened to the in the area, I wouldn't mind eating here. Might even be a go-to if I lived here. There's nothing worse than getting bad sushi, its pricey enough as is. So while this place isn't top shelf, its clean, service is fast and friendly, and the fish will be good. Nothing really negative to say about my experience here.
author: Arron E.

description: Friendly staff, otherwise a putrid experience. Entrees were served at different times. The supposed-to-be cooked meat was raw. Had to be sent back. Sushi rolls were okay at best. Udon soup was extremely bland and plain and blah. Would not go back.
author: Greg W.

description: The food here is amazing. Even down to the gyoza and California rolls, everything tastes delicious and high quality. And even better their lunch special is a great deal $11.50 for 2 items plus soup salad and rice.
author: Samantha H.

description: This is the perfect neigborhood spot to go for a quick yummy dinner. I love these guys, their sushi is amazing. My favorite is the asparagus and onion tempura roll- wow! Great food and cozy atmosphere.
author: Rachel N.

description: Our office's all-time favorite Japanese restaurant in this area. We place group lunch order almost every week for over a year; and the food and service never disappoint us! Their 2 or 3-item lunch combo is the most popular item among us together with the variety of maki, tempura, and seaweed salad. Strongly recommend to anyone who want to order sushi for takeout.
author: Rui Z.

description:
By the end of each gym week, I just want food that doesn't come from a shaker bottle or a bar wrapper. If luckycat statues and raw sealife are involved, all the better.

Standard / easily accessible / #basic menu surrounded by friendly service and great music covers (Al Green, Earth Wind & Fire, Bee Gees, etc).

(^_^) Warm Unagi Churn Fun #avocados
(^_^) Paintings #mustachebird
(^_^) Silverware #handlecarvings
(^_^) Watermelon #surprisedessert
(-_-) Scallop Crab Cakes #saltyspongebob
(-_-) Moriawase Sashimi #basic

Clean, comfortable neighborhoody place. Wheelchair lift to the slightly elevated back area, orange-gold luckycat up front. They really thought of everything.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place is consistently the best delivery sushi I have found in 6 years of living in San Francisco.  After 25 delivery orders, I've decided to finally write a review.  

If quality of fish is important to you, then Mizutani is your place.  The maguro nigiri, salmon nigiri, chu-toro nigiri, and pretty much any other nigiri I've had from them have all been quite good and very consistent each time.  O-toro delivery?  Yes, they do that too and it's damn good.  Their tamago is good and takes different shapes depending on the chef.  Kuradai, saba,  escolar, tobiki, all quite good.  Yes, you may be able get better fish from an omakase joint, but Mizutani is hands down the best bang for your buck quality fish you will get for Sushi delivery.

I highly recommend any of the basic maki rolls: tekka maki, negi toro maki, sake maki, hamachi maki.  As most mid level sushi places, these type of rolls are just stomach filler.  At Mizutani, these rolls are made very well so the quality of the fish is able to shine through.  You're getting sushi - doesn't that mean you want good quality fish? Mizutani has shown me that if a sushi place can't make a good tekka roll, it's not worth going back.  If a place needs to dress its rolls up with things like wasabi mayo or whatever summer sauce is, then they are often trying to mask the fact that they have low quality fish.  This is not the case at Mizutani.

Try delivery from this place.  You never knew delivery sushi could taste so good.
author: Zach M.

description: Finally got to stop by for lunch and eat in for the first time. Great, fresh sushi and reasonably priced. The lunch platter with five pieces of sashimi, one maki roll, miso soup and a salad were sumptuous.
author: Abhi M.

description: Super nice service. Cozy space. Great food. Can't beat their special platters. Had sashimi, chicken teriyaki, uni... tasted all fresh and we'd definitely go back.
author: Thomas R.

description:
You know that feeling you get when you walk in somewhere and feel welcomed and at home? This place instantly makes you feel that way.

What makes the experience so special here is the way the staff treats you. It's a family owned place, and they take care of everyone here like family. This spot has caught my eye before because it's on my way home, and I finally had the chance to stop by yesterday (3/30/16). Such a good decision!

I ordered the 10 piece chefs choice of the Nigiri. His final picks were: Maguro (Tuna), Hamchi (Yellowtail), Sake (Salmon), Tako (Octopus) and the Albacore (White Tuna). First off, the presentation was incredible. These guys really know how to bring up a good looking dish. The only thing that's more important is the taste, which they execute flawlessly. The fish was so fresh, and you can just tell by the way it melts in your mouth. Stunning! (Check out the pictures).

I also got a two rolls: one with Tuna and one with Salmon. Again, the presentation was fabulous for such simple rolls. You can really tell the care and dedication that the chefs put into their fish here. It's not a rushed job. The food does not come out quick but the end result is unbelievable. 

Final verdict: Top notch service, high qualty fish and amazing presentation are just a few things that make this a true gem of the Richmond District. There's not many places that manage to nail every aspect of what a restaurant needs to succeed, but these guys knock it out of the park. Make your way over here.
author: Alex B.

description: This has got to be one of the worst places I have had sushi in a long time. The fish was not fresh and bland. Almost uneatable. The delivery was just as bad. It took 2 hours to deliver, they just dropped off the order downstairs without calling or letting me know it arrived. I asked for extra soy sauce I only got 3. I asked for extra wasabi, I got none! Sloppy and careless service. Horrible experience.
author: Sebastian B.

description:
Nice low-key sushi spot that just opened up 2 months ago.  They are so generous with their sashimi portions that I was left almost wishing for more rice lol (see pics).  Although it's not the best sushi I have ever had, its fresh and solid and one of the best I've had at this price point.   In addition to the Sashimi/Sushi Combo, got one of the rolls, and the Agedashi Tofu (albeit not traditional but still tasty).

Service was great - they are super friendly and attentive.  Come check it out!
author: Olivia T.

description:
Visiting my daughter and her roommate who are living in this area and had a craving for sushi. This place had some good reviews so we decided to give it a shot. The food was great. Beautiful presentation and delicious. 

The hamachi carpaccio was of particular note. I could have had a few orders of that!  There was a surprise salad that arrived, complimentary- mixed greens and iceberg lettuce with a ginger peanut dressing that was wonderful. We had the Dynamite Roll (amazing) and the California Roll, which was unique with a crunchy topping.

I might remove one star because we were there for a long time. 2 hours. We had 2 tables beside us who arrived after us and their orders were taken before ours. There was inconsistent attentiveness. They also forgot one of the rolls we ordered, even after reminding them that it hadn't come. We were full anyhow but it was just the principle of it. 

I would definitely go back - I still want to try that other roll!!
author: Traci B.

description:
I had this place bookmarked for some time as a place to try. Recently I finally did so in a Sunday evening because I was going to nearby Sakesan but there was a long wait for a table, so I decided to come here instead.

I ordered their chirashi. Their sushi rice was quite good, done in a way to match that which I experienced and loved previously. As for the fish, overall it was mostly good but the butterfish felt like it could've been better. It's usually one of my favorite standards next to hamachi. The red tuna and salmon were fresh and good, though doesn't quite match places I consider as favorites for (I know it may be unfair to compare like that but that's what been happening now that I established places as favorites for certain items). I also ordered their two-piece oyster special (midnight oyster) but was disappointed in its make-up; I've had better for similar price at some other places I've often visited.

On the other hand, the complementary salad that come with my order was definitely a plus.

The service was nice from the two young ladies I got services from. Especially liked the one wearing the grey t-shirt that night. :)

I'd say 3.5-plus stars for the above, which would've made it four stars. Unfortunately I was disappointed by one thing. When they asked me what I want to drink I asked for tea like at most Asian restaurants, but didn't realize they charged $1 here. I would've asked for water if I had known especially since I was figuring on ordering some kind of sake like I often do at a place like this.  I need to remember that should I return.
author: H K.

description:
I have nothing but positive things to say about this place. From the moment you walk in the door  they greet you with a smile. 

We arrived on a Friday at about 8:45 and were sat instantly. Our drink orders were instantly taken. The daily specials were given to us. 

We ordered Uni nigiri, a chiriashi 10 piece, the bay island roll  and the Lion something roll and of course a large house Sake. 

The complimentary house salad came first. So delish! The home make the dressing and I must say it was fantastic. A tasty peanut vinegar type dressing. Next came the bay island.. I eat a lot of sushi and I have to say this is one of my favourites of all time! This is the roll that will keep me coming back again and again. All of the sashami was nice  and fresh. 

As if the food being so great wasn't enough I have to give a shout out to our waitresses. Very attentive and aware of our needs. Nice calm and friendly personalities. On top of it with their suggestions and knowledge of the menu. 

Thanks for a wonderful sushi spot. Keep up the good work and quality. We look forward to coming back and trying some more items.
author: Lynn D.

description:
Report card 
Ambience - 5/5
Service - 5/5 
Variety - 5/5
Taste - 5/5
Value for money - 5/5

I was pretty surprised how I haven't given this place a review yet. I tried sushi for the first time here. Being a vegetarian that is a BIG thing for me!!  I was always skeptical of the vegan/vegetarian sushi, tasting as good. But I was proven wrong, and since then I have never missed a chance to go to this place and have sushi. What an outstanding place! 

I would highly recommend their Avocado Inari and Asparagus Maki, Avocado Cucumber, Carrots and Sesame Maki and Eggplant Maki. I have always ordered atleast one of each and it has never disappointed. The rolls just perfectly melt-in-your-mouth and are very flavorful. I also like their candied ginger which is a lovely accompaniment to the sushi.The wasabi here is milder than most places though. Also there is a always this complimentary salad, which has the perfect peanut sauce dressing.

You would also want to try the sake or the tea. Usually they have the brown rice tea, which i feel balances out the sushi perfectly.

I find their food, service and ambiance flawless. They always make you feel welcome and serve incredibly fresh sushi. Sometimes even adhere to my whims and fancies when I order custom rolls or ask for an extra dash of sesame seeds. Kudos guys!! Keep up the brilliant work. With that kind of perfection, you will always have me as a loyal patron.
author: Poorva J.

description: Best delivery sushi in San Francisco! I challenge anyone to find a better value, all with quality, fresh sushi, amazing chefs and staff. Plus, they make their menu items so well. We love this place! Free Cali doesn't hurt either
author: Andrew R.

description: Such a great find in Inner Richmond neighborhood. They have fresh specials everyday.  It also passed my raw fish sensitive tummy test.  ;) ordered agadeshi tofu which was hot and had a great taste,  not too salty.  Seafood salad was also yummy.  Had two spicy rolls to top it off. Decor was simple and classic too. Will be back.
author: Hoosie U.

description:
I was recently hit with a craving for sushi and eager to venture out to a new place. After a search on the Yelp mobile app, it was down to 3 options that were within a 20-minute walking distance. Mizutani looked & sounded appealing and it fit the price expectation for that night (I was more in the mood for a cozy neighborhood spot than a fancy $$$$ place with a sushi tasting menu). 

The place was somewhat empty when we arrived, with just one other table occupied, but filled up throughout our meal there. The decor is clean and simple, in line with most sushi places I have been to. Our waitress was extremely sweet and attentive throughout our whole dining experience. 

We opted for the following food:

Special of the day - Midnight oysters: raw oysters topped with a quail egg yolk, tobiko, and scallions. These were super fresh and purely delicious. I generally like my oysters clean with nothing on them, but in this case I was pleasantly surprised. It felt very reminiscent of a hamachi shooter.

Sashimi Sampler - 20 pieces of 5 assorted fish varieties (maguro, saba, sake, hamachi, escolar). The fish was super fresh, served as generous thick cuts, and very tender. 

We also ordered a couple of their specialty rolls. Minimal rice and lots of actual fish and veggies inside, just the way I love my rolls. 

Mizutani will be a go-to spot when I crave some sashimi, rolls, and a large hot sake!
author: Anna R.

description: Had the oysters here, they are so fresh and big! The omakase is so yummy and special, nice layout too!  Service is excellent! Love coming here
author: Mable L.

description: Very decent sushi. Staff are friendly. Always busy but can usually get a table. Garlic edamame rocks!
author: Andrea G.

description: The service was quick. We got it to go because finding a place to park was very hard.
author: ROSA S.

description:
Not the best, but not the worst. 

The most memorable thing about this place was the super friendly staff. 

I ordered the chirashi, which was pretty good but definitely not mind-blowing. A couple of pieces (I forget which fish) were served too cold, seemed like it was close to frozen. I'm glad I wasn't that hungry because it wouldn't have been enough to fill me up otherwise. The salmon and tuna were very fresh though. We also ordered the Cherry Blossom roll: salmon avocado sushi wrapped in tuna. This roll was the highlight of our meal imo. 

We came here on a pretty chilly night so I was excited to warm up with some hot tea, but their teapots and cups do not insulate well so the tea cooled down within a few minutes. They gladly refilled it for us when I brought it to their attention, but we were still charged for cold tea. Meh. Probably won't be back. Daigo is still my favorite sushi spot in the Richmond.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
FRESH UNI. The entire dining experience was impeccable, the service and food was on point. 

FOOD: 
- complimentary salad
- Warm Unagi Churn Fun, a unique take on using churn fun...so good 
- 2 orders of fresh uni 
- Heather roll
- Double Hamachi roll 
- Seared Yellow Tail over a bed of spinach 

So much food but so delicious. I would definitely reorder the Unagi churn fun, uni, and Heather roll.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Great neighborhood sushi place, with a $15 lunch menu with three items plus all the fixings. Among the choices are really great tempura and salmon teriyaki. Lots of sushi and sashimi choices, including some special cuts for an extra $3. Very neighborly service.
author: Will L.

description: This is a delicious restaurant ! The fish is always fresh and tasty. The chef does a wonderful job with flavors, starting with the house salad dressing and ending with the mochi.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Came here a couple times when they just opened. 

Sushi: super fresh and surprisingly reasonable prices. I like salmon and the salmon here are not skimpily thin for the sashimi

Appetizer: I never got a chance to try the uni egg appetizer. However, I ordered the usual fare like agadashi tofu and hamachi Kama a couple times. Agadashi tofu was ok, but the hamachi Kama was really big

Pretty easy to get reservation and service is great.

I would definitely come back
author: Ruxin H.

description:
Finally writing a review, as I order delivery through Eat 24 enough times that the delivery guy has said "nice to see you again".  Disclaimer: this review is only for food quality as I have not been to physical location and cannot speak for in-person service.  With that being said, I have been consistently delighted with the quality of fish I have received.  I try and order a new roll each time, and haven't been disappointed. The delivery is always way quicker than the Eat 24 estimation (assuming because I don't live too far from Mizutani).  

Tonight: ordered some tempura, and its still super crispy.  Was half-expecting soggy/cold tempura due to travel time, but nope. Still hot, still crispy, def delicious.  Not to mention, the tempura order is quite substantial.

Definitely need to make a point to visit them in person, but until then, thank you, Mizutani, for consistently giving me a reason not to cook, nor leave the comforts of my couch.
author: Gina D.

description: This place is a true gem! The service is awesome, the music is very smooth and the service is very kind and available! The Simon roll and super salmon roll were absolutely delicious (and fried)! The lunch combo was good ,, nice and fresh Nigiri
author: Rachida I.

description: Came to this place since we were in the area. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and they were very friendly. They gave a salad on the house. I normally don't like the salads that come at a sushi place  but this one was excellent because of the dressing. We had 4 rolls which were all really good. Our favorite was the sumo roll which was so amazing that we got another one. We will definitely be back!
author: Jac E.

description: Mizutani has become my go-to sushi delivery place when I want something yummy and quick. The Walnut Prawn roll is my favorite, but just about everything I've tried has been delicious (Bento, Lizzy, Rainbow and California roll are awesome as well). I've never been to the restaurant in person but can vouch for quick and easy delivery with Eat 24!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Mizutani replaces Chin's (which i never tried). decor doesn't exist unless gray walls count. jazz music in the background. nothing japanese about Mizutani except the name.

eats: 2 item lunch special (not called a bento box since it comes out on a square dish) 10.95
-miso soup too much msg, couldn't finish
-lettuce salad, dosed with miso/peanut dressing.
-salmon  teriyaki, 2- 3 oz. portions, slightly above average
-shrimp tempera, 2 shirmp & 5 veggies, slightly above average
-sashimi entree choices +2/3 depending on fish.

temaki:
-still hungry afterwards, menu pricey
-15% off, grand opening promo
-very friendly service.
-wouldn't repeat, cheaper alternatives available.
-sashimi overpriced...chirashi choices +2/+3 if hamachi, tuna, ....chosen.
author: Victor G.

description:
In the land of Chinese owned Japanese sushi restaurants, this is the newest member with new decor, still smelling of construction, with staff alert and ready to please.  We sat at the bar and started ordering off of the specials list - Uni. A quick question from the waitress to the sushi chef in Cantonese, do we have Uni?  No, not today.  Bad start but whatever. 

I'm really not a fan of Chinese or Korean owned Japanese restaurants (I'm chinese so this can't be racist) - sometimes I'm tempted to categorize these types of establishments as a separate cuisine, which is how I'm rating this, not as a japanese restaurant. I want to be fair and not judge a business by my preference.  

-Service was excellent. 
-Food was well presented, clean, and did not appear compromised
-Left the restaurant odor free

Would not recommend for sushi purists, but if rolls are all you desire, by all means enjoy them here.  We won't be returning, but we appreciated the 15% off special.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Sunset stripped roll all the way! I don't remember what my friend ordered but everything we had was amazingly fresh. The service was 5 stars all the way. The hot tea was tasty and continuously refilled hardly without us noticing. I can't wait to go to the city next so I can come back and try some more delicious sushi.
author: Debbie P.

description:
David is great. We coming back for more because of the freshness and flavorful variety of choices. 
Must try! One of the best in SF. We've tried many places in the bay area.
author: Eugene W.

description: Yummy sushi and no lines because it is still fairly new and not well known. Nice friendly staff.
author: Katty L.

description: Was fortunate to have sushi catered. We got to try the sunflower roll, sumo roll, shrimp tempura churn fun, the sunset stripped roll, and the mizutani roll. Must say it was pretty good. Love the mango in the sunflower roll, the sumo roll had a lemon soy sauce drizzled on it and had a hint of garlic to the roll. The tastes was very inviting in your mouth. The shrimp tempura churn fun was my favorite!  It is wrapped in a thin sheet of rice noodles,  very much like rice crepes from dim sum.  Nice contrast of the spicy tuna and shrimp tempura. On the pricey side but they are very fresh. Minus 1 star for finding fish scale on my piece of sushi. Will come back to try other rolls.
author: Alicia A.

description: The reason I give this restaurant 5 stars is because I was expecting 3 stars and was very pleasantly surprised! My friend and I came here after not being about to get in at another restaurant down the street. As promised, there is no line to eat here. It seems the staff and chefs are Cantonese and the menu is mostly of the basic fish varieties and dynamite rolls (you know, huge rolls covered in sauce and scattered with tempura flakes and the like). We sighed and resigned ourselves to a night of mediocre sashimi, but that was not what we got! We ordered a sashimi plate of 10 slices of fish and it came beautifully served on top of a bowl filled with ice. The sashimi pieces were sliced THICK and were fresh and firm. We also got uni nigiri that was fresh and yummy. What really stunned us though, was the live scallops dish which was one of their specials. It ended up being a huge plate of tempura, which the waiter told us was the scallop muscles. It tasted like deep fried onion strings. The actual scallops were really thinly cut and served as 6 pieces of nigiri. There was a also delightful and surprising yuzu sauce to dip those into. The scallops were live, so tasted super fresh. There was so much food that we couldn't finish it all and the bill only came out to $30 per person. That's fairly incredible for super fresh sashimi served in such generous quantities that you can't even finish it! Service was also great. I would definitely come here again for sashimi and for ordering items off their specials menu. The restaurant should also consider expanding their regular menu to include more of their specials and more authentically Japanese items. I don't think the menu reflects the high-quality of their ingredients and the caliber of their chefs.
author: Cat M.

description:
I am a huge fan of Mizutani. Let's be clear.

I've ordered delivery through Eat 24 maybe...20-30 times for this place. After a certain point I started going to the restaurant because I wanted to see what they were like 'in person'. I have so far been very happy with everything. There was one time were the service was a little sub-standard, but I think it was an isolated event. 

The sushi is very, very good. The rolls are great and the sashimi/nigiri is good too. They have a specials board and every time I go I order about 1/2 of my meal from it--and I have so far not been disappointed! 

I trust them well enough that I'm willing to try new stuff that I didn't before like (I'm looking at you butterfish...)!
author: Cori N.

description:
Delicious, fresh fish.  Really creative and maki and special rolls.  Very good oysters.  Friendly and fast service.  
Will absolutely be back!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Solid delivery sushi for weekday nights. Mid tier sushi so rolls are much better than sashimi/nigiri. But the rolls are always fresh and tasty; they're all pretty good. Agedashi tofu is delicious. They give you a free roll about a certain order amount (I think it's $40 but I can't remember). 

Definitely satisfies "sushi craving while lying around in pjs" for a reasonable price (hence my 4 star rating). But if you're looking for melt in your mouth otoro or uni while sitting at the bar, this is not the place.
author: Erin C.

description: Sushi and delivery is spot on. The quality of fish is great and they are reasonably priced. Also, the teriyaki chicken is so good, it's not the basic blah chicken with sauce you can find at Safeway. It's full of veggies and sauceless! Trust me, it's good, and you don't feel gross after eating it. My fav place to order sushi/dinner from in SF.
author: Nina N.

description: Very tasty sushi. I really enjoyed my meal and would definitely go back. I got one of the regular rolls (Caterpillar) and one of the specials (fried salmon belly, I believe). The wait was a bit longer than expected even though it was very much empty when I went. But it was well worth it because the sushi was probably the best I've had in the inner Richmond.
author: Robert A.

description:
Small and clean.  Not much $$$ was put into decorating the place but that's ok.

Super fresh and delicious.  Wanted to take more pics but hunger won.

I would return.
author: David P.

description:
We order delivery from here quite often as we are sushi fans and sometimes it's just easier than cooking:)

Favorites are miso soup, lizzy roll, sake and gyoza.  They will give you free california roll if you order a few rolls.
author: Suna L.

description: No idea how the food is in-person but don't risk delivery: I was told the food would be ready/delivered in 45 minutes. 2 hours later nothing. When I called the person who picked up the phone said the order was out for delivery; 30 minutes later, no delivery. When I called back the person on the phone said she couldn't reach her delivery person. 0 stars.
author: Sam H.

description: Nice owners and you always get a complimentary salad. Sushi is fresh and delicious. We're repeat customers.
author: Gregory C.

description:
We placed a delivery order on the Eat24 app at 7:17, with an 8:17 delivery time. At 8:27 I requested an update through the app, and it said the order would be leaving the restaurant soon.

At 9pm we still didn't have food, and after getting a busy signal a bunch of times I finally got through. The woman said it would be another 25 minutes -- meaning over two hours from when we placed the order -- and then hung up on me.

I had to call back again, and even though it was literally one minute later the woman talked as if we'd never spoken. I was finally able to cancel the order, but we'll certainly never be ordering from them again.
author: Kent H.

description: I'll give this place full star for overall. Food fresh and tasty with all kind of Creative creations. Pricing decent for me comparing to others and Staffs all friendly and always make sure things going right. I'm impressed to find this place in my Neighbourhood. Definitely my favourite Japanese restaurant so far in this Neighbourhood.
author: Unyo N.

description: I love this place and probably order from here every week. It really is the best delivery sushi I have had in SF. Yummy rolls, fresh ample sashimi, and super friendly delivery. Love you guys!
author: Susannah B.

description: Mizutani is my favorite sushi spot in SF. Their nigiri is incredible, always extremely fresh. I probably eat here 3x a week. The owners are so kind and are super welcoming! You have to eat nigiri here!!!
author: Katrina C.

description:
Came here two times for dinner. The servers are very friendly and helpful! We had the Fried oysters, Bay Island roll, and the Godzilla roll on one occasion and the Chirashi and Semibei roll  the next. 

The fried oysters were hot and tasty but a bit small. Definitely liked the Bay Island more than the Godzilla. Godzilla was good, but oddly, thinly sliced. The spicy sauce added some nice heat though, not too much to overpower the other flavors. 

The Chirashi is big enough for two people to share or to satisfy one hungry diner! Lovely selection of fresh fish on top of a good portion of rice. Came with a small salad beforehand. The Sembei roll stole the show though. Crispy, hot, with smooth delicious spicy tuna on top! The tuna has a good amount of heat, more than the spicy sauce, but doesn't distract from the tuna's flavor. Honestly, one piece in one bite is a bit much and you don't get to enjoy the flavors each component has to offer. I'd recommend trying the roll all in one bite first, and then eating the tuna and roll separately to appreciate all the flavors offered.

We also had the mango shochu cocktail. This actually comes in a large bottle for sharing. It wasn't prepackaged but mixed upon order and it was nice and strong!! My girlfriend and I were tipsy after this dinner but we had rough days at work so it was well deserved!

Would definitely come back again as long as that 15% banner is still waving!
author: Karina L.

description: I've never been to dine in person, but my husband and I order delivery from here just about once a week to get our sushi fix. The food is excellent. I always order the same thing but my husband likes to switch it up each time and has never been disappointed. The food always arrives on time and many times even early. I highly recommend Mizutani Sushi Bar!
author: Blair H.

description:
Went here for lunch today and had a great experience! We actually ended up stepping in at 2:27pm and when leaving, saw that they closed for lunch at 2:30pm and still served us! It was very nice of them.

Overall great service, extremely accommodating and kind staff and got cute little complementary watermelon pieces for dessert! The food was really good as well, perfect amount of food for a lunch special. Good spicy salmon roll, teriyaki and salad. Will definitely be going back :D yay!
author: Sita K.

description: Friendly and warm staff! Clean and cute interior! Fresh,delicious sushi! So amazingly good!
author: Karen F.

description:
I don't know how this place has 4.5 stars. 

I went here for lunch with my friend and just got Sushi Combo with comes with 5 pieces of sushi and your choice of a roll. I got a spicy tuna roll which is usually okay but this was too salty and was just bad. 5 pieces of sushi with a roll was $14.50 or something like that. I think it is definitely overpriced and over rated. This place is JUST OK. There are tons of other nice places around this area. Don't waste your time or money.
author: C M.

description:
Mizutani is great and it's especially awesome that they deliver.  I generally get nigiri and there is only one other place in the neighborhood that I consider better quality (sorry, you'll have to figure that one out for yourself - those who take the time to explore are always rewarded for their efforts in this city, or at least have a magical adventure along the way).  

They are also super nice and I've never once experienced any issues with my orders online or in person.  Happy to have them nearby!!
author: Nicki L.

description:
I had such a wonderful experience here. The owners were so friendly and I had a lovely conversation with them during my lunch.

The sushi was fresh and the price was amazing for San Francisco. The rolls were creative and delicious. They had many "fresh" rolls options so I was super excited about that.

Service was A++++. I'm new to the Bay Area so the owner took time out of his day to tell me more about the Bay Area.

PS...who gives a crap if this place is Chinese-owned? I don't think it matters who makes your food as long as it's good!
author: Linda D.

description: Had lunch here today, the food was top notch in taste & presentation. Well worth the visit!
author: Jason S.

description:
confession: my friend and i were originally planning on eating across the street at a different sushi restaurant, but it was closed so we ended up at mizutani for a nice saturday lunch!

we sat at the bar and ordered two lunch special combos and a magic roll. the roll was a solid size, the filling size was substantial, and was the favorite item of our meal. my lunch combo was hamachi sashimi and chicken teriyaki, and my friend ordered tempura and salmon sashimi. the salmon sashimi was perfect texture and super fresh, but for some reason the hamachi was ice cold. it tasted fresh (i think), but each piece was so cold it almost gave me a brain freeze! the tempura was pretty good as well, but the chicken teriyaki was a bit rubbery and required more chewing than the normal chicken teriyaki would.

service was great and our waiter was friendly. even though some of the food was a bit sketch, i would come back and give it another chance.
author: Caitlin C.

description: 1 hour and 40 min - past delivery time and still no food has shown up. I called multiple times to only get lied to in regards to the status of my order. After 40 min of waiting, I had to speak to grubhub to find out my order still hadn't left the restaurant. It is now 40 min after hearing that my food supposedly has left and still nothing. I think the the food is alright at best from previous experiences, but the service makes it terrible. Be ready to wait without any apologies from the restaurant or any reason for as to why it was so late. Even more shocking that they even have a delivery fee for such a bad delivery service. Also be prepared to receive your food wrapped in a brown bag smelling of straight up cigarette smoke.
author: Phoenix L.

description:
A very happy 5 stars to Mizutani! I'm sure sushi purists will try to find complaints but as someone who adores Japanese food but isn't trying to be a sushi snob (we're not looking at jiro dreams of sushi here people!) I wholeheartedly enjoyed every bite at Mizutani. 

The quality of fish was outstanding, the rolls were innovative and the flavors were unique! That is what I noticed the most, it wasn't just the generic flavors you get at any Japanese restaurant, you could tell everything was made in house with a homemade recipe. Great example was in the shared starter salad, it wasn't just the generic ginger soy salad dressing (which don't get me wrong I enjoy the generic kind no matter what) it was a carefully crafted absolutely delicious homemade version of a ginger, sesame dressing that made the complimentary starter salad one of my favorite things I had that night! The Teriyaki also wasn't just that tar-like generic overly salty glaze. Instead it had so many unique flavors that still was reminiscent of teriyaki but with a complexity that I thoroughly appreciated. And yes the summer roll is a fan favorite for good reason, don't miss out! But I also enjoyed their roll's that were wrapped in cucumber instead of rice and seaweed, they were delightfully refreshing. 

Of course as everyone has mentioned the service is what makes this place so outstanding. They have a very thoughtful and attentive staff that is eager to give you a great dining experience. This attention to detail is mirrored in the quality and presentation of their food. Don't go in trying to rush in and out, instead I encourage everyone to take their time enjoy the good quality food and even better quality people. They don't rush you or try and get you out the door, it is nice to feel like you can actually take your time and enjoy a good meal with your company once in a while. Mizutani is owned by a couple and you can tell that they put a lot of tender love and care into their business. I support any small business owner but have a soft spot for couples chasing their dreams :)  I will be SURE to be making this my new spot with my girlfriends!
author: Katie W.

description:
Mizitani is a new Japanese restaurant that recently opened up in my neighborhood so I've been eager to try it out. 

First, the service was attentive, prompt and friendly. We received a complimentary salad which had a gorgeous sesame dressing. My kids had the chicken udon which to my surprise, had a lot of chicken. My 7 year old loves tekka maki and the pieces of tuna were the largest I've seen in this type of roll. He inhaled two rolls so fast I was unable to get a picture to post. I got the Summer roll which was a very creative and delicious roll. 

My kids are in love with this new neighborhood sushi bar and we will definitely be back. Quote from my 7 year old, "it's sensational!!"
author: Kimi U.

description:
Came in last night around 9pm for a quick bite while waiting for my GF to get off of work. It wasn't one of those highly anticipated sushi dinners that you spend all day at work dreaming about, just popped in on a whim. We had ordered take out twice before from here but this was my first visit for a sit down meal. The place was mostly empty save for one table in the back so I just picked out a spot at the sushi bar and seated myself. Had no idea at that point how happy I was about to be with my dining experience! 

For starters, service was polite and attentive without being annoyingly overbearing. With the place being as empty as it was, it could've gone either way really.  I asked for water to begin and was given a nice light side salad to get my motor running. I ordered albacore sashimi, which is a go to for me, two of the specialty maki and an Asahi draft. It may have been my lack of expectations but everything really was just perfect. The beer was crisp and cold, the sashimi was fresh and delicious and both rolls were surprisingly fantastic. Went with the Godzilla roll and a Sunset Stripped roll, each was delightful in its own right and complemented one another well. Nice presentation and wonderful flavors. Everything was just the right amount to fill me up and I'm a pretty big guy. No regrets on not ordering a third roll even though I usually get 3-4 rolls w/ sashimi most occasions. Added a to go roll once the GF arrived and we still got out of there under $50

They have a good amount of basic rolls that're under $10 but most of the specialty rolls are right around the 14 dollar mark. Since it's the grand re-opening after a remodel and ownership change, all orders are 15% off right now. They do deliver but on one occasion during the NBA finals they weren't able to accommodate due to low staff levels. That's somewhat understandable though so I am willing to grade on a curve. Nice ambiance, fresh off of a remodel, but nothing that'll land in Architectural Digest. Flat screen TV above the sushi bar so you won't need to miss the game just to satisfy your fresh fish fix.

*Edit* Forgot to finish my review and post but have eaten here numerous times since and the quality of food and service has held up. Good fish, good service, good call. Will be my go to neighborhood spot for the foreseeable future.
author: Kareem C.

description:
When we saw the new sign with the big Grand Opening Special, we dediced to try it. Then we came back with a friend. And tonight I ordered take-out for the first time. I hope they do well, because it's a very competitive city for sushi and for that matter there are multiple choices within seconds of where they are. With that I lend my support for 10 reasons: 
1. They couldn't be friendlier.
2. The fish is first rate
3. They have interesting rolls and a lot of special fish
4. They couldn't be friendlier.
5. When they opened they offered a discount.
6. When I asked if that was still in effect they said that they no offered a free edamame or California Roll.
7. Good location.
8. It's a nice looking place.
9. The prices are fair.
10. They are definitely on our regular sushi place list (and we are very, very discerning about sushi!)
author: Dennis S.

description: Great sushi, excellent service, and very clean! Loved it and would highly recommend. Greatest sushi in inner Richmond!
author: Anna G.

description:
I've only ordered delivery from Mizutani but the sushi is GREAT! My go to order is the Walnut Prawn roll, the Cherry Blossom Roll, and an order of veggie tempura +the free California Roll that comes free with a $40 delivery order. 

Pro tip: if you're ordering delivery, ask for the Walnut Prawn roll in its own container. It's sauce tends to drip onto the other rolls. 

While Eat 24's wait time typically says an hour or less, most of the time my food comes within 30 minutes. 

This place would have received five stars but had to knock one off when the delivery man asked if I would tip him "for his services" before even having a chance to give me the food I had ordered. I had a tip in my hand to give to him but found it impolite that he asked for a tip.
author: Kat M.

description: I ordered the Lizzy roll and Godzilla roll. Both were delicious and I will definitely have sushi from here again. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because I ordered delivery to the Inner Richmond and it took an hour and a half to arrive.
author: Natalie R.

description: We order take out from Mizutani about once a week. The rolls are always good and their delivery is pretty quick. Would highly recommend their sushi for take out.
author: Matt S.

description:
Not bad but half the rolls contain some kind of fried item. We ordered the Super Salmon roll because the menu didn't mentioned it being fried but when it came it was deep fried. The Tempura Sweet Potato was good and quite a large portion. Also got the Sunset Stripped Roll which contained no rice and was wrapped in a rather thick strip of cucumber. Kind of thought it was going to be a paper thin version of cucumber but wasn't. So was a bit disappointed in that. 

The service was friendly but they got super slammed about 30 minutes after we got there so the food slowed down and the aforementioned Super Salmon roll came out kind of late. 

Would be good if their menu had better descriptions of the rolls.
author: Christopher U.

description: No. Not good. Salmon was off. Rice grains were smashed into a paste and cold. Chinese owned Japanese restaurant. Don't believe the high star reviews. Waitstaff very nice- sesame dressing very good. Otherwise, no.
author: Troinex C.

description: While the food is good, I've never had a great delivery experience from this business. I have roommates who sleep early and a very hyper dog who goes insane when she hears the doorbell, so I ask in my delivery notes for them to call when they get here. Every delivery driver has rung the doorbell, and given me a terrible attitude when I tipped $1 (should've called, I would have tipped more). Maybe it's time to suck it up and take the 40min bus ride to pick up my food then.
author: Princess D.

description:
Mizutani is a great addition to the inner Richmond. The fish was fresh and the service friendly and on point. The tempura appetizer was heaped high with lightly battered fried shrimp and veggies. Leaf shaped wasabi was cute! The decor is open and inviting.

4.5 * stars
author: Brady K.

description:
Unique flavors, fresh fish, excellent service. The servers are very responsive and friendly. We had the following:

Oyster with quail egg -- it wasn't  on any menu, but we saw yelp pictures and asked about it and they were able to provide. It was good, but not the best I've had.

Hamachi Hand roll and Spicy Tuna Handroll - standard taste and nicely wrapped. Nothing was spilling out over the top nor was it coming out of the bottom. Nothing super special about the flavor though.

Shrimp Tempura Churn Fun - this was an interesting concept. The sauce that came with it was really good, but not sure I would order this again.

Heather roll - SUPER GOOD. The jalapeno butter was a nice touch and the fish was nicely seared. It was a bit heavier than I expected, so I wish I hadn't ordered all of the above :)

I will definitely be coming back for a round 2!
author: Stephanie L.

description: The service was excellent. The waiter explained the fish they offered and included the origin of each. His demeanor was happy and welcoming. The salmon, however, was bad. Yes, I mean aroma. I may have given three or four stars if I didn't know the sushi chefs thoroughly handled the sashimi prior to serving it. Itamae  do this for a living thus would have known immediately, and should have vetoed the fish before it ever hit a plate. So I find that it's not just bad fish, it's also dishonorable Itamae. Shame on you.
author: Amanda P.

description: Wow, this is an unexpected gem in the Inner Richmond / Lake Terrace area. The service was impeccable and food was delicious. The albacore tuna nigiri was marbled and fatty and melts in your mouth. The chicken yakitori skewers were crisply spiced and well portioned for one order (3 skewers for $6!). We also got a complimentary salad and a small fruit dessert on the house. Overall a great value. They're also doing a 15% off for July 2015 and perhaps the first few weeks of August 2015.
author: Ajay G.

description: We just had this delivered and it's already gone -it was that good! This was our first time trying, but surely won't be the last!
author: Lisa L.

description: I was very disappointed in their lunch service today. I brought two coworkers after raving about how good the food was, but we left extremely disappointed and pressed for time. My food and one coworker's food came out in a timely fashion, but my other coworker's food didn't come after over 30 minutes -- and none of her food even had to be cooked. So while myself and one coworker were able to eat 65% of our dishes, my other coworker didn't get to eat at all. Furthermore, when we told the server we had to have the orders boxed up and taken to go because the food still hadn't come out, it took over 10 minutes to bring the boxes. While the food that we did get was good, the pace of service was below par.
author: Bianca P.

description: Came for lunch with 2 kids. We sat at the bar and got lunch nigiri combos and grilled squid. The California role was one of the best I've ever had. Enjoyed every aspect of our meals from salad dressing, miso, roles, to nigiri selections.
author: Jessica R.

description: One of the best Japanese places I've been to. Great service, extremely fresh fish, and a very nice place to sit down and eat. Be sure to get the Omakase!
author: Andrew N.

description:
We were extremely satisfied with the service and the food. I had the chef's choice sushi and it was great. The fried banana was amazing.

This is from Annika: I was craving sushi badly and I was extremely happy when we found Mizutani sushi. We were served an excellent miso soup right away and we didn't have to wait long for our sushi. I had 2 different kinds of veggie rolls which were both splendid. The atmosphere was nice and cozy, the servers fun and friendly, and the soy sauce was out of this world. Ah. And the prices were good! I'll be satisfying my sushi needs here again!
author: Alipasha Z.

description: Awesome, authentic Japanese food. Some of the freshest sushi I've had in SF. Very reasonably priced and the service is fast and genuine. Try it out you will be glad you did!
author: Julian L.

description:
delivery 
decent prices 
tasty thick cuts sashimi
cute notes on boxes (i asked nicely for uni in our chef sashimi order in case they might have some, but they wrote sorry, no uni today : )     --- disappointed yes, but cute note + points!

maybe one of these days, we'll stop in to check this place out. : )
author: Donna H.

description: Fresh sushi and good service! We had the fresh oyster, sashimi combo and other rolls, they all good! A must try grand opening sushi place! They are offering 15% off now what a great deal!!
author: Mable L.

description: Fresh, delicious sushi that's wonderful for takeout or eat-in. I usually go for salmon-based sushi/rolls but have also tried the chicken teriyaki, miso soup, gyoza, salad, etc. and everything has been great. When eating in, the service and atmosphere are solid and the food is consistently good. And for sushi delivery in the Inner Richmond, Mizutani is the only place I trust :)
author: Kelly L.

description: Had the seared yellowtail, California roll and salmon sashimi. No regrets! Except maybe that we should've came hungrier!
author: Kevin K.

description:
There are several sushi restaurants nearby that appear to have quite a following so try any one of those before heading to mizutani. Most of our food was okay but putting up with the arrogant, ignorant waitress dampened everyone's spirits. My super easy going husband quickly remarked on her "Plenty of attitude."  Sadly he was right. 

Not only did she send a cucumber salad we did not order, she literally confronted us with the plate and insisted we had ordered it. None of us had and we insisted that we neither ordered not wanted it. 

Next she brought us "the house salad" which she mistakenly called  the house salad ( menu had a house salad) a couple more times before she said it was complementary.  

I'm allergic to soy, which I told her as soon as we were seated, and requested that all sauces be served on the side so that my dinner companions could enjoy them. Needless to say, nearly all the sushi came either with soy or sauces containing soy drizzled on top. And don't order the special calamari, it wasn't good and we didn't nearly finish it.
author: Laurie P.

description: The best sushi I've had so far in SF (though I haven't tried very hard yet). Humble, reasonably priced, and delicious, this Richmond Japanese restaurant is a fabulous choice.
author: Garrett D.

description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant, period. The food is outstanding every time - the ingredients are always super fresh! The staff is friendly, courteous, and accommodating. I am conflicted when I tell people about this place, as want it to stay my private little gem...however, it would be selfish for me to keep it to myself, hence I'm telling you all now. Hands down, there's no need to go anywhere else for sushi once you've been here.
author: Danielle P.

description: I'm a big fan of this place, I moved to the area and was pleasantly surprised to find a neighborhood sushi spot. My favorite rolls are the Sumo Roll and the Lion King Roll, but I've tried a bunch and enjoyed them all. The service is pleasant and attentive and its a nice place for a quiet dinner. It's not that big, but it doesn't feel crowded like some other nearby places. Definitely worth trying out!
author: Allison T.

description: Not many places great you by name after only a few times here. I can only say I love this place for making me feel welcomed, the ice cold beer (I cannot say enough about how satisfying that is), and their super fresh food. It just makes me want to come back more and more. They are doing something right.
author: Matt A.

description: Service amazing! Go with the chefs recommendation or just pick anything off the menu, you won't be disappointed. This place is a gem!!
author: Tim L.

description:
Initially walking into the restaurant, my party and I were greeted with a somewhat off-putting odor, but we persevered in light of the polite and attentive greeting we received from the staff. We sat at the sushi bar and had one representative from each of the three lunch specials. 

I had the second lunch combo, with 5 pieces of nigiri and a spicy salmon roll. The fish was phenomenal; very fresh and well prepared. The rice, albeit a little cold, was properly cooked. 

I would recommend this place for a great lunch at fair prices.
author: Alex M.

description:
I see this place has 4.5 stars so obviously there are some loyal eaters here. I will say, the service was very good and everyone was very responsive and smiled throughout the meal which is something you don't see as often these days when you eat out. That part, I did really like about the place.

That being said....the food has to be decent and this was very very average. I don't eat rolls so I am judging this primarily on the nigiri and sashimi. 

Ordered the 20 piece sashimi and every special off the board except the blue shrimp. 

The 20 piece sashimi was rather tasteless and the texture was not soft/smooth as you would excpect or hope for. Tuna, Hamachi, Albacore, Salmon, Walu. Pretty standard stuff. Only the Walu was decent. The rest was very bland

Specials were a good list. Striped Bass, Uni, Seabream, etc. Decent stuff as far as daily specials. Again..it just wasn't very flavorful. 

Maybe a bad night, who knows. But it just is really nothing special. For as many choices as there are in the city...this place just offers sushi. My guess is there are a ton of local patrons that walk here and the convenience factor is what plays into it. Not worth the drive from any other part of the city
author: Adam W.

description: Please save your money and eat somewhere else. The food here is so awful it made me write a review to warn others. This place is overpriced and the food took forever to arrive and when it did it was terrible. The teriyaki chicken was rubbery the sauce was overly salty. The sushi rice was super mushy similar to mashed up rice. The grill squid was the worse it was cold and very tough to eat like it's been frozen for awhile. The only positive was the sashimi which was just ok but not enough for us to come back. The minute you sit down they ask you water or tea but they charge for tea and don't tell you that till you see the bill.
author: Karen L.

description: Good spot - ordered takeout.  The delivery took about 20 minutes longer than the expected time however.
author: Germán P.

description: Walked in here for lunch right at closing (@2:30pm). I had the pleasure of meeting the owners, David and Akiko, who were incredibly accommodating. The sushi and service were great! I have not had much luck finding decent sushi lunch spots in the neighborhood, until walking in to Mizutani. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Jason S.

description:
sushi was fresh and tasty!! they also add free roll and delivery arrived super fast!
i definitely recommend!
author: Inbal M.

description: Excellent Chirashi and well done udon. We've found our new favorite Japanese restaurant in the Richmond!  Warm and welcome staff made our night! Most definitely coming back soon!
author: Britt S.

description: David and Akiko have brought the old Chins venue back to life with fresher fish, a livelier vibe, a updated interior and even a flat screen over the bar. Very much new and improved!
author: Rob G.

description: Went here for a birthday celebration lunch. The wait staff was great and the food was affordable and good quality!
author: Thomas D.

description: Definitely a solid sushi restaurant and that's saying a lot for sushi in San Francisco. Really fresh fish and delicious rolls. Simon roll is one of my favourite rolls. The uni was excellent but slightly overpriced. If you intend to feel full, expect to pay $30+ per person.
author: Daniel F.

description: I would love to give ZERO star if I could seriously! The WORST Japanese restaurant my friend and I both have ever been to!! We saw 4.5 stars Yelp reviews and expected great! We are both Japanese and very very disappointed and so disgusted by their foods!! I saw how sushi makers (I can't even call them "chefs" because they don't have no skills of cutting and preparing fishes and making nigiri sushi).  We only had 2 appetizers and no more! We even had to send one of the appetizers back to the kitchen to cook more longer because we didn't want to get food poisoning from undercooked not so fresh seafood!  Hot tea wasn't hot at all.  We left for dinner at different place. It was just wasting money and time!! DO NOT GO there if you really want to have a good Japanese food!!!
author: Haruka I.

description:
Parking is a pain.. Anywhere here in sf but Richmond is one of those districts where you'd literally have to be prepared to mentally fight other drivers for parking spaces. This restaurant though is definitely worth a try..

Their fresh quality fish here got me wishing my stomach was bigger than my eyes and on top of that, great customer service! Attentive, informing, and a family vibe made this restaurant feel very welcoming. 

In general, everything is kept very clean and presentable. From their nigiri to their combo lunches and as well as the dressing on the salad gave me an excuse to return to my childhood sometime soon. 

Thank you for your great service and food. See you soon.
author: Kevin L.

description: Was a favorite... But just went in and they've discontinued my fave comfort food, the shrimp tempura cheong fun roll.   I was so disappointed I left as that was what I went in to get!
author: Susan R.
