description: Excellent salmon skin roll;  crisp edamame; savory butterfish sushi and lemon zesty Lizzy roll roll was fresh and light. Service was excellent. Ambiance: lighting and music just right.
author: Fiona M.

description: Ordered delivery from here over 5x times now, and every time its been delicious. You can usually order delivery during the day which is a huge benefit when other local options are crappy and unhealthy. Really delicious seafood udon and tempura this time! Also delivery was speedy and nice. Big fans!!
author: Chen Z.

description: I have been a regular customer since they opened. Not only is the sushi excellent, but the family that runs it is warm and service focused. I have tried many different items on the menu and have loved most of them. The fish is top notch and the rolls are creative, interesting and delicious. I highly recommend it for both dine in and takeout.
author: Peter J.

description: I love this place. I order take out from here at least a couple times a month and have always had an amazing experience! The food is a great deal for the price and the fish always tastes fresh!
author: Allison S.

description: The food was decent.  I'm only posting a review to state that this restaurant is NOT wheelchair accessible.
author: Jolene L.

description: Found a long black hair in my udon, and although they apologized, they still charged me for it. Gross and ridiculous!
author: Aryeh N.

description: I came here with a friend and we were seated right away. The workers were very friendly and welcoming from the moment we entered the restaurant. The decor was super nice and cute, and the atmosphere of the restaurant felt very homey. The food was of high quality and tasted delicious!! I had a very good experience here and will definitely return.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Very tasty food; lackluster atmosphere and service.

Went to Mizutani to check it out as I'm new to the neighborhood, and invited my family to come too as they were in town. I called ahead and they took a reservation on a Saturday night with a half-hour notice, which was very nice. When we arrived, we were seated promptly though we didn't have a choice of tables -- ended up being by the door where other parties were waiting, which wasn't ideal, but still workable. The downstairs area doesn't look like there's much thought put into it, atmosphere-wise. Besides the sushi bar and counter, there are 2 4-seater tables and the decoration/lighting/etc is functional and pretty bare bones -- it looks like you'd expect of a waiting area where people pick up takeout, not where parties are seated for dinner. Upstairs was a bit darker and removed from the waiting parties, but the same atmosphere -- bare bones and functionality, so if you're looking for cozy/romantic/atmospheric setting, I would say this place is not it.

We came for sushi and the sushi didn't disappoint. The menu is large and varied, and there is a lot of sushi variety with cooked fish preparations, which was good for a pregnant lady who is avoiding raw fish. There are also entrees, salads, crudo, etc-- would definitely like to come back and try more of the menu.

We had the seaweed salad (OK, but for $5 I hate when there's mesclun underneath bulking up the dish's volume -- I like to get all seaweed for the money); the free salad had a very tasty dressing; the house salad was also good. Our variety of rolls was tasty, plentiful, and beautifully presented. The chef's special of raw fish looked fresh and delicious. The only problem is the sushi counter was either backed up, or the system for placing orders isn't working well, because our rolls came out over a really....looong...stretch. We ordered 5 rolls and 2 other dishes for 4 people, and the first person got their food well ahead of the others; then the rolls came out one at a time, with long breaks in between, so by the time those of us who had ordered rolls finally got all of them on the table, the first person who'd been served had finished eating by a long shot. This made for a very awkward and annoying pacing to the meal, especially since some of our rolls were getting cold. It took something like 40-45 minutes between when our first dish and our last arrived, which is unacceptable. And at one point it became clear that they'd forgotten to put one of the orders in. If you are like me and like to assemble everyone's order on the table and eat simultaneously and alternate sushi bites and figure out your bite trading strategy-- this was just a pain in the ass and an annoying experience to our dining companions.

Bottom line, food was great and reasonably priced, but pretty disappointed in the service. Might try them again when they're slower so their sushi orders don't back up.
author: Nika T.

description: Great spot!  Ordered takeout, and opted for two of their special rolls: the Lion King Roll, and the Walnut Prawn Roll.  The Walnut Prawn roll was great - I hadn't tried a comparable roll before, and really enjoyed it.  The Lion King roll was also a good choice.  While not my favorite Lion King Roll of all time, it was still quite solid.  This is a place I can see myself coming back to in the future.  Enjoyable sushi all around.
author: Zach S.

description: Mizutani is my favorite sushi place that delivers. Sometimes they can be a little slow w the delivery (over an hour) but the fish is always really fresh and their rolls are flavorful as is their sashimi. They have nice sized portions for nigiri. If you order over a certain amount they throw in a free California roll which is really well done, I think one of my favorites.
author: stephanie s.

description: My husband and I ordered delivery through eat24 and they were so wonderful. The food was delicious and the man who delivered was extremely kind. They even labeled everything nicely. We will definitely order again.
author: Jenna V.

description: Very fresh sashimi and very nice staff. Clean,  great food for great price.  Kids loved it too. Family friendly.
author: CR L.

description: So delicious and everyone is so nice! The gave me a salad (on the house) that was delicious, right after I placed my order and gave me fresh watermelon (also on the house) right after I finished! Not to mention my meal was delicious and fresh! I will totally be back there!! Instant favorite sushi bar... Yum!
author: Bianca H.

description: Total fail. Sushi was more than 30 minutes late. Summer roll was seriously tiny for $12. The sunset striped roll wasn't the freshest fish...and then I bit into BONES in my sushi. Took over 1.5 hours to deliver bad sushi with high prices...no thanks!
author: Julia C.

description:
Beautiful well designed sushi plates. We had one served in the shape of a flower!  Gorgeous!   

Service was extremely friendly.  Seems like a family run spot.  

They are eager to please and the sushi was tasty and presented beautifully.   Fantastic neighborhood sushi.  I will definitely go back.
author: Jen P.

description: Great sushi restaurant with extremely friendly staff! This is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant. All the food and fish is really fresh, and the tempura is never greasy! PS--- SAPPORO ON TAP!
author: Aviva K.

description: This was my 1st time ordering from this place. I wanted to try a different variety from the Japanese restaurant I usually order from.  The sashimi is not fresh. It is gummy and dark in the center which is an indication that it was previously frozen for a lengthy period. Im very particular when it comes to my sashimi.  I did not eat it since the first piece I tried was gummy so I did not want to spend the rest of my day sick from bad sashimi. The rolls are ok. Nothing great but nothing horrible. Price is comparable but not for the quality. I still taste that 1 piece of sashimi I had, thats how fishy it was. I'd pass from ordering here.
author: D.T. C.

description: I would give 5 stars, however an incident this evening almost warranted a 1 star review. I have ordered from this sushi spot around 10 times in the last month. I LOVE them, my special requests are honored almost 100% of the time. Usually my orders are around $35. This evening, I placed an order through Yelp which uses Eat24's service, as I always do. Our order of $60 worth of food took 1 hour and 30 minutes to arrive. Though this was a frustrating wait time, we understand that it was a large order on a Saturday night. What was really frustrating was that after our wait, we received an order with only one set of chopsticks, and one of our meals appeared to be missing. We called the restaurant with our concern,and  explained that we ordered the shrimp tempura roll, but were given the shrimp tempura appetizer. The woman began to explain that I, the consumer made a mistake. Then I continued to explain that what I ordered showed a photo of a shrimp tempura "roll" and that's what we wanted. She then told me to call eat24 and find out what went wrong. I told her I was not going to do that, we ordered through a site that they use, and it is not my job as a consumer to check that the menu is represented correctly. I explained this was someone's dinner, and she again tried to tell me to call eat 24. The conversation was quite upsetting and we informed the woman we would not be ordering from them again, and were going to write a poor review. We decided to call once more, and speak to a manger. Glad we did. David, the manager, promptly offered to credit us for the correct roll, or bring it tonight. We opted to have it tonight, given it was someone's dinner. The roll arrived within 10 minutes, we believe David delivered it himself. We were quite impressed with the turn around. I am happy to say I will continue to be a loyal customer, I just may think twice before ordering during a busy time.
author: Kristina H.

description: Delicious food that generously caters to vegan/vegetarians and non-veg diets, as well. The service is outstanding; their sense of hospitality is excellent and very much appreciated. It's a very clean restaurant, with nice ambience, and very reasonable prices. Highly recommended!!
author: D. B.

description: Everybody should order Mizutommy Roll from the secret menu. U won't regret the surprise.
author: Anthony L.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Excellent super fresh fish and killer service. Best deal around for lunch combo.
author: mike m.

description: Came here for lunch with a friend yesterday.  This decor, the staff and the food is GREAT! I got one of the combo's for lunch and the staff was very willing to make substitutions with no complaints. They also gave us 15% off our order and little watermelon pieces for dessert!  Had an overall great experience and will be coming back again!
author: Ranna K.

description: we love this place and the new owners are such a very special family.  great service and food!!  sushi is the best!
author: Tiffany G.
